page.title: 20TOWN CENTRE.HUNTINGDON.
page.content: The town has always been the centre of an agricultural area.It was a great coaching centre the main hostelries being the Falcoln,the Fountain and the George.As the railways developed it was the natural choice to build into a great railway centre,but the Earl of Sandwich opposed this idea and refused to sell the land.Huntingdon thus remained a small population of some 5,000 people until the policy of bringing people out of London after the war caused its considerable expansion.The town centre today is still relatively small consisting of a narrow High Street.An addition to the high street has been Chequers court.In the high street are banks,building societies,supermarkets,shops and stores. .
